intro: Pilosella detonsa, commonly known as the slender hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pilosella detonsa is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
